creator: mike@ds808.net
text:
DecodeInterceptor writes to log on every call.  It should only write to the log 
if debug > 0.  This unneccesarily fills up the log very quickly.  The 
workaround is to disable it which does not make sense.

creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
text: A better workaround is to set debug="-1", which should shut it up.

creator: mike@ds808.net
text:
Yes. William is correct.  This is not a bug since it was designed that way 
which is ok.  Did not know debug goes below 0.  Now I know.  Thanks.  Marked 
this bug as invalid.

creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
text: This is now fixed in the CVS HEAD, and should appear in the next nightly build.
